job description:
The Data Analytics Engineer designs and develops analytic code, predominantly in Scala (and Spark), Python and/or R as part of a growing multi-disciplinary team of Data Scientists, Engineers, and Solutions Experts with deep domain knowledge working to develop new capabilities and workflows. Responsibilities include:
  • Developing analytics for customer applications (ad hoc analysis to production-grade pipelines and workflows)
  • Providing mathematical algorithms and implementations to serve the needs of data analysis workflows
  • Understanding customer business challenges and sourcing the most appropriate data sets, algorithms, and architectures to solve them quickly and cost-effectively
  • Refactor algorithms into production-quality and operational code
  • Working collaboratively and interact with client project team members and operational staff to support live customer deployments
Qualifications
  • 2+ years of data analytics experience
  • Expert knowledge of Scala or Python
  • Expert knowledge of SQL
  • Experience with agile development
  • Adept at learning and applying new technologies and solving new problems
  • Interest in data analytic technologies such as Apache Spark, Apache Pig, AWS Pipelines, Google Dataflow and/or MapReduce
  • Experience blending analytic and simulation modeling approaches to problem solving
Desirable
  • Experience with other functional programming languages including Erlang
  • Advanced mathematical modeling skills
About Fractal

Fractal Industries applies artificial intelligence to solve complex, real-world problems at scale. Our Human+AI operating system, Fractal | OS, blends capabilities ranging from data handling, analytics, and reporting to advanced algorithms, simulations, and machine learning, enabling decisions that are just-in-time, just-in-place, and just-in-context. If this type of environment sounds exciting reach out to us directly via application at https://www.fractalindustries.com/careers with a resume and cover letter.

Fractal Industries offers a competitive salary, incentive stock options, a full range of benefits starting day one, including 401(k) and medical, dental & vision coverage, flexible Personal Time Off (PTO) plan and 10+ paid holiday days per year

Internal Job Title: Data Analytics Engineer
